result.execSummary:
The defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Pursuant to plea negotitions and on motion of the state, Court ordered charge AMENDED to a County Ordinance #63.01, Disorderly Conduct to which defendant plead guilty.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including costs and surcharges by 9-25-2017 or case converts to a civil judgment.

Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  William G. Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.   Student Intern Samantha Feak under the supervision of William Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests additional time for defendant to complete community service. State does not object to one additional extension. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  William Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION/court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
No reply from surety/defendant.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for pretrial conference.  Defense has received discovery and offer, and requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

ADDRESS INFO for Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley
Current: 2061 N. 56th St., Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 04-04-2016)
Prior: 4320 W Olive Street #434, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley in custody.  Mark Patrick Dooley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Davis, Br. 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Xsavis Q Crowley-Bentley not in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 03-20-2015 at 01:30pm
